projects.title: Interpretable Machine Learning for U.S. Life Expectancy (County-Level Analysis)
projects.description: Integrated multi-source public health datasets (CDC, County Health Rankings, Environmental Justice Index) addressing missing data, feature alignment, and multicollinearity to construct a robust modeling dataset. Applied interpretable supervised and unsupervised learning techniques including regularized linear models, tree-based methods, and k-means clustering, achieving MAE ≈ 1.3 years and R² ≈ 0.7 under k-fold cross validation. Productionized model outputs into an interactive GitHub-hosted dashboard highlighting predicted life expectancy and top contributing factors across U.S. counties.

projects.title: Semantic Segmentation using PSPNet with ResNet Backbone
projects.description: Implemented a PSPNet-based semantic segmentation model with a ResNet-50 backbone using PyTorch, integrating dilated convolutions, pyramid pooling, and data augmentation, achieving ~56% mean IoU on the CamVid dataset. Improved segmentation performance to ~63–65% mean IoU through fine-tuning of network hyperparameters, learning rate, and regularization parameters, enabling pixel-wise classification across 11 classes on CamVid.
